alert.note: Alert for Motherlode (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 25 at 3:40PM PST until March 01 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM SUNDAY TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 feet possible above 2000 feet, 4 to 10 inches down to 1500 feet. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Motherlode. * WHEN...From 10 AM Sunday to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible with extended road closures. Blowing snow will cause white-out conditions at times. Downed trees and limbs with local power outages are possible due to heavy snow and gusty winds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels 2500 to 3000 feet Sunday falling to 2000 to 3000 feet Monday, 1500 to 2000 feet on Tuesday. Periods of heavy snow Sunday with snow showers lingering into Sunday night. Another round of heavier snow is expected Monday into early Wednesday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
